Reviews.Title: “Budget and basic, but comfy as you like!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah C
Reviews.Content: Really bright and breezy double room, if a little on the cosy side, with super comfy beds. Didn't manage to make it down for breakfast (I blame the comfy beds), but luckily with Lydl selling freshly baked croissants literally across the road (at bargain prices), we didn't miss out. You're also less than 30 seconds from the nearest slightly dodgy, but friendly, coffeeshop, which is handy when you've just dumped your bags in the hotel after your flight. Also, just down the road (about a 1min walk) is the Albert Cuypstraat market which is great for buying all your souvenirs and Amsterdam-related tat at slightly cheaper prices than you would be charged in the centre. Don't be put off by the comments on the location of this hotel - it is out of the city centre yes, but it is situated on quite a quiet (and seemingly safe) street, which is the ideal retreat from the hub bub of the city centre. Perfect to come back and switch off. Plus it takes only 2 minutes to walk to the nearest tram stop from which you can get the number 7 or 10 tram which will take you through the museum district (past the Heineken experience) to Leidesplein within less than 10 minutes. Staff were also really friendly and helpful, and the rooms and linen were clean (I even brought bleach-wipes and pillowcases just in case, but had no need for them). I wouldn't say that the rooms were exactly sound-proofed, but I wasn't disturbed by any of the other guests. Only occasionally could I hear someone talking next door or walking upstairs - I brought ear plugs, but again had no need for them. All in all, it really depends on what you expect to get for your money - if you pay beer money, expect to receive beer, not champagne. I like beer, so it was fine for me :) I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “what you save (if) doesn't worth all those dislikes”
Reviews.Author: Hansvg
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a lovely city, but It was terrible because of the hotel... The recepcionist isn't nice at all, everything it's a problem, he is not going to make it easy. Breakfast, just a piece of bread and cheese and a glass of juice or something like that Room service... mmm... I don't know because they "forgot" our room (fortunately I stayed only two nights) The rooms... my dog has a better one: the aisle to get there was totally dirty, no blanks in my room, beds are smaller than single size!, I can't imaging how do they do that.. the bathroom was awful too, each time you opens the faucet a lauder engine, pump or something starts to knock the wall like those machines used to brake the streets. Internet is paid, but even if I would been asked for it, signal was to weak. And location it's quite far away from the central station and hot spots. It's impressive that much can i speak of a a room so small. The money you save doesn't worth all those uncomforts and dislikes

Reviews.Title: “Would def stay again”
Reviews.Author: eva15000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a twin room with my friend, and we were absolutely satisfied. The location is great - everything is in 20 mins walking distance. Our room was tiny, but you dont wanna stay in your room if you'r in Amsterdam anyway! Bathrom was tiny as well, but clean - we got fresh towels everyday. Staff were very friendly and helpful with everything. We would def stay again as the hotel is cheap, the location is great and the staff are really nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “You do not get what you paid for.”
Reviews.Author: kjnielsen206
Reviews.Content: I booked online through Booking.com and paid in advance. The photos of the place were probably photo-shopped as the hotel is rather shabby. The room we got was no bigger than one for a university dormitory. The single beds were maybe 30 inches wide at most. The shower/toilet combo was small but adequate and the sink is in the room. There is a Lidl supermarket across the street, you are a block from trams 4, 25 and 10 which will get you to the train station, Dam Square or the museum district. The Wi-Fi is accessible in the dining room, the main entry hall or the landing between the 2nd and 1st floors. There are dozens of hotels, many better and many equal or worse than the Hotel Max. I paid $100 per night but I think it was due to the long Easter Holiday. I never go on holiday for the hotel but honestly I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “max”
Reviews.Author: Leila A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was too small and beds were soooo small and uncomofortable! The bad thing is that bathroom is not in the room! The walls were so thin so you could hear people talking all the time.Staff were nice,location great!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Angelamsterdam1
Reviews.Content: :). Nice service, good breakfast!!!!!! I can recumbent this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdaming”
Reviews.Author: Ereche
Reviews.Content: The best accomodation in Amsterdam, a nice place, excellent service

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: paulmclaren
Reviews.Content: the price is nice in relation u get. the staff is helpfull two star basic rooms with tv, free internet and in cute area of amsterdam. good hideaway in amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “nicely surprised”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Value for the price! I've read a whole lot of bad reviews, but i would definitely stay there again! the only bad thing was it seemed like a really long walk home from town center after a long day. clean enough, some dust under bed , but didn't notice that until the last day. Towels get changed everyday. Very satisfied

Reviews.Title: “More minimum than Max”
Reviews.Author: David W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very welcoming and helpful, but that was the only good point. Very small beds in a very small room with a very small wardrobe. Very small shower room, with a toilet crammed in to a very small space, so much so that it was impossible to sit on the toilet other than side saddle! Noise from other guests rooms combined witht the small and uncomfortable beds meant a very poor nights sleep .Breakfast very basic with poor quality luncheon meat and cheese, not an egg in sight. The advertised Wi-Fi didn't work in the room although it did if we stood out in the corridor. We had originally booked for 4 nights but left after the first one.

Reviews.Title: “The most disgusting room I've ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: Nelly B
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs! The room was horribly grimy and dirty with mold growing on the bedroom walls and in the shower. My boyfriend woke up with a chest infection after staying here because the room was so damp and musty. Our door didn't lock properly and was hanging from a single hinge. The staff were really unfriendly and the breakfast was inedible. If you must stay here avoid the "garden" room, it's literally a shed in a horribly back yard.

Reviews.Title: “basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: sjwagdomEire
Reviews.Content: around 15 to 20 mins walk from the centre, this establishment is basic but clean. OK for teenage travellers on a budget, walls are paper thin, beds smaller than average, 4 flights of stairs to room, have to sit on the loo sideways if you want to be able to close the door etc!!, but if you're looking for somewhere cheap to crash its ok.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Max Amsterdam Doesn't Deserve You!”
Reviews.Author: GorillaDaze
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted by the friendly, informative staff we knew we had arrived at a unique and inspiring Hotel. Having to pay â‚¬20 as a deposit on the TV remote and keycard is a perfectly normal way to operate a Hotel and ensure guests do not lose their hotel keycard. Although I have never encountered this sort of service anywhere else. I was travelling with 4 couples and one of them was lucky enough to have paid extra for the Garden Suite which was a fully detached property in the Hotels extensive grounds. I stayed in room 6 which was brilliant, overlooking the bustling market outside, it came complete with spacious bathroom suite and LCD TV system. The shower came with its own squegee ensuring that I could leave my room as clean and fresh as I found it. Which I thought was a brilliant touch, one which other hotel chains would be wise to emulate. After all I dont know about you, but cleaning my hotel room in a morning is the perfect way to ensure I come back to a clean room. Who needs cleaners? My bedding was of sufficiently high thread count that I felt like I was wrapped in a fine slice of parma ham. My bed was comfortable and luckily the LCD TV system extended over the bed so I could obtain maximum televisual pleasure whilst maintaining my core body heat. Breakfast was a voyage of discovery across many continents with freshly squeezed "prime" orange juice, delicious blue mountain coffee and fresh crisp patisserie from the local artisan baker. There was also a selection of the finest cheeses, with prime slices of Iberian cured ham and freshly picked Tomatoes which I convinced myself came from their extensive and highly cultivated Garden. In summary I have seldom been welcomed in such a fashion. staff were attentive yet not intrusive, always available, nothing was too much trouble, I arrived early for instance and they were absolutely perfectly fine with that, insisting that I leave my bags in their unattended, unlocked, breakfast room. I can honestly say you would be hard pressed to find a Hotel that offers such an amazing and at times quite astonishing levels of service and cleanliness. Amsterdam truly does not deserver this Hotel at all, I would recommend the park bench beside any of the canals before asking you to endure the Hotel Max. I hope you will comeback and let me know how enjoyable your trip was. ;) or take the wise route and just don't book it......no seriously, don't stay at this Hovel.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: justerino
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here during August 2011, while travelling around Europe. The hotel itself is very run down and in need of some updating. We stayed for 2 nights in what we called 'the brothel room' The room was painted all in red, complete with red carpet. It was an extremely small room, with a small sink near the door and a seperate shower room complete with toilet inside the shower and a squigy as there was no shower curtain! Since the only small window in the room did not open properly, there was a constant smell of must. Just thinking about the room now makes my skin crawl! The good thing about this hotel was breakfast. There was a variety of things to choose from and set us up well for the day. There were bread rolls, slices of ham and cheese, fruit, cereal and toast. There was also juice, coffee and tea. We would not go back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever you do, Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ChrWal
Reviews.Content: Booked in here for one night and I really wish I should have gone somewhere else! I was in one of the "Garden Rooms" which is basically a dirty shed in the garden that has been converted into two rooms. The room was clean but the facilieites in the room were either broken or unuseable. The shower was hanging off the wall, the toilet was filthy and the wall was so thin to the next room you could here them coughing! Not a very nice place, if you can, go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “If ever possible, choose a different Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EkkehardDomning
Reviews.Content: We staid in this Hotel during the IBC (International Broadcast Convention, a international Radio and Television Tradeshow). In this time all Hotel rates in Amsterdam are increased to allmost infinity, in our case to 147 Euro per double room, which is still in the price range for the lower class hotels. The Hotel looks very dirty, the carpet on the stairs are sticky and the original color could be a kind of blue. The rooms are small, some are smaller. In the bathroom of the smaller ones, the water of the shower could be used to flush the toilet. The beds are ok, so I slept well. The cleaning service only arranged my bed, and did not cleaned the toilet, or emties the trash basked during the stay. The floor was in very bad condition, since water hat added black surrounding to the laminated tiles. After running a whole day in Amsterdam, I like to walk on naked feet, but not on this floor. The breakfast is very poor. Some cereals, one kind of cheese and saussage, coffee. The people working are not very kind. My colleague forgot his key-card in the car, and they are unwilling to open him his room and want to charge 5 EUR instead. The location of the Hotel is not too bad. A supermarket is located on the other side of the road, Leidensplein and Rembrandtplein are in walking distance (20min), Tram station is not far. Conclusion if you can get if 25 EUR and not expecting a clean room, give it a try. But if you have to pay more, try to find something different.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY-DIRTY-DIRTY!!!”
Reviews.Author: marta d
Reviews.Content: I wonder how such a place got rated as a 2 star hotel... Being generous I could say is a youth hostel and even in that case is too dirty. I knew the rooms were small and noisy but i was not prepared for the dirty and smelly bathroom. I asked a employee of the hotel to come and check that the shower was having black spots all over and the guy told me :" This is not dirt, it is the humidity!" If you wanna have your room cleaned you have to ask for it...in 4 nights we have been there they did it just once and is was not even properly clean after. Breakfast is terrible: every day the same things from the LIDL supermarket in front of the hotel. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Simple Breakfast and shower”
Reviews.Author: paulmclaren
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay in amsterdam. We advise my friends to go here

Reviews.Title: “I'd also rather sleep at the Park! TERRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: SB_NZ
Reviews.Content: Cheap. But that's about the only good thing! But not cheap enough for what you get! We were told it's close to the train station, it's a 3km walk across the other side of town. The receptionist was rude and on top of the room we were charged a credit card fee of 5% (which was charged before we came - so too bad if we wanted to pay cash and save money!), a city tax, â‚¬20 safety deposit for the room key and for Internet! The room was SO small, my boyfriend and I couldn't both put our bags on the floor. Let alone open them! Or walk past each other! The shower and toilet are together - the shower floods the whole place and you have to mop up after every shower. The breakfast - stale bread, soggy tomatoes, hard cheese, empty canisters of orange juice. Served in basically a dungeon! We stayed three nights (only cos we'd paid in full) - our room and bathroom weren't cleaned at all. Their idea of cleaning was putting new (ripped) towels on our bed. Without even making it! We never saw any of the staff (sounds like a good thing!) and I would NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN! Not recommended. Stay in a backpackers. Or the Park!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here as should be advertised as a hostel and not a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Shelliebee
Reviews.Content: We were given a twin room instead of a double room. When we went back to the reception, staff made us wait and told us they had no double rooms. They were very rude! Room was so tiny and dirty! Toliet was in shower and breakfast was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Brothel - avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: mew84
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we thought that the hotel would be fine. Although the room was tiny and the toilet was in the shower, it appeared to be clean and quite central. We dumped our bags then went around the city. When we arrived back that evening we saw the true Hotel Max. The sheets were disgusting and the paper thin walls left nothing to the imagination when the guest in the next room had a prostitute with him - luckily she was very efficient! Throughout the night, the heavy fire-proof doors were banging and crashing, meaning a broken night sleep on the tiny, lumpy beds. Breakfast was fine. cereal and toast. I was going to complain about the situation but the men at the reception were not helpful in the slightest. Be careful when you check out - we had to pay a Â£20 key deposit, which the receptionist would have pocketed had we not asked for it! We stayed 4 nights. If we didn't have to pay for the full stay on check-in, I would have move to a different hotel. It wasn't a plesant stay in the slightest!

Reviews.Title: “You should avoid”
Reviews.Author: mariuszah
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Max Hotel in May 2009. We searched for a hotel in Amsterdam for quite a while, and could not find anything cheap, so we finally booked Max. You should try to avoid booking this hotel, because of the following reasons: - Our bed sheets were dirty. We asked the staff to change them, but the "new" sheets they brought were just as dirty. - The room we stayed in was very, very small. We literally didn't have enough space to walk around the bed. When one of us was sitting, the other one had to stay in bed, because there was not enough room. - The bathroom was dirty. - Breakfast is not great, but I've seen worse. The location was decent and safe. While the hotel is not very central, we didn't mind the walk to the center.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in worse.”
Reviews.Author: kal_87
Reviews.Content: I can understand where people are coming from when they stay here and rate it poorly. I've stayed in much better and worse, bit at least it was private and had clean sheets and towels. They need to lower their rates and perhaps advertise as a hostel type lodging as this is no place for romance, real relaxation or the elderly. You could hear conversations through the walls, and yes the toilet and shower were one room which is strange especially for Europe. It was a tiny room in the basement making it cold during the night. The location is central to the museum district. There it a coffeshop across the street as well as a grocery, another draw for younger travellers. The manager was extremely pleasnt with only one truly cranky reception guy who would not even reply when spoken to. It wasn't the nightmare I had anticipated but also wasn't worth recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: Josho_83
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Max Hotel in Amsterdam a little over a week before we were due to arrive. We booked it through a booking website called Hotel Club. When we arrived at 11pm on the Friday of our stay, the check in clerk told us that they had no record of our booking and simply shrugged his shoulders and said "i dont know, we are full". We then had to call the booking agent and complain and they told us that they had received a booking confirmation from Max and that it was their responsibility to find us another hotel. They did this for the first night, in a hotel that cost more at our expense but they were fully booked for the following night. We then organised with Max that we were to return after 10am the next morning to speak with the manager and have another hotel organised for the Saturday night. When we arrived the manager wasnt there and we were told that we couldnt call him to speak with him. Hotel Max told us that all the hotels with the same cost in the area were fully booked and that the only available ones were too expensive. We spent an hour on the phone to Hotel Club who couldnt tell us who was going to pay for our accommodation and in the end offered us a hotel at the Airport for the same cost as the original booking. In the mean time we did our own calling around and managed to find a dorm room for an exorbitant price. As a result of Max Hotel's mistake, we spent around an hour in their reception on the Friday night and 3 hours on the saturday which is not desirable on a weekend trip. I wouldnt recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NOT STAY HERE IF YOU PAID ME! WOULD RATHER SLEEP IN PARK!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jani_und_Jesse
Reviews.Content: Where to begin?!?! WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!! WOULD NOT CALL THIS A HOTEL. SLUM OR GHETTO WOULD BE MORE APPROPRIATE!!!! We Arrived late at night and the door to our room was left open!!??? We were greeted by three big spiders hanging on the door. The light in the room was broken so we had to make do with the bathroom light. The room was full of mosquitos and bugs and smelt like an old underground basement. The room appeared to have water damage and was very damp there was hair and dust on the floor. The room looked like it hadnt been cleaned in years. there was cobwebs around and under the beds. The bathroom also looked like it had not been cleaned in years the shower had scum up the walls and around the edges and there was long black hair in the shower. The shower had a water pump that sounded like a machine gun. The sheets stunk like they hadnt been washed. Spent the night in sleeping bags trying not to touch anything. Not fussy people but this hotel has to be the worst ***PLACE*** we have ever slept in our life. When leaving the `garden house' I almost broke my foot falling through the broken decking outside the room. When we talked to the receptionist they didnt seem much to understand english and was wearing very casual sports clothing. If we wernt so tired and were not leaving amsterdam the next day we would have left immediately. for 55 euros a night this was shocking, The park would have been a cleaner and nicer place to sleep!!! take my advice, spend another 20 euros and stay somewhere else and enjoy your stay in AMSTERAM!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, small hotel, wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: plasticniki
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel over the August Bank Holiday weekend. We didn't expect much considering the price we paid, but we didn't expect to be greeted with such a dirty room on arrival. There were hairs on the floor and in the beds, the shower hadn't been cleaned properly and I don't think the bed linen was fresh. The TV remote also didn't work. Also, annoyingly, we were not provided with a bathmat, and there was no doormat - as we stayed in one of the 'garden' rooms and due to the rain this was quite a problem with letting leaves and water in. We've stayed in such a wide variety of accommodation before, from Â£20 hostel-style rooms to pricer rooms and I can say without a doubt this is the worst room I have ever stayed in. On the other hand, the location is okay - a bit of a walk into the center on Amsterdam but the area around the Albert Cuyp market is nice, a lot of good bars etc (try Gollum, amazing) and the breakfast was okay compared with other 'continental' breakfasts I've been subjected to - of particular note is that fact they provide you with proper orange juice, not watered down stuff. The breakfast area is quite small however, so you might find yourself waiting for a table. I wouldn't recommend this hotel at all, unless you really aren't fussy (my boyfriend and I are FAR from fussy but we like to stay in clean rooms).

Reviews.Title: “The staff made our stay much better.”
Reviews.Author: leopaixao
Reviews.Content: Well, if you are reading the reviews on this hotel, you will see that the rooms are very small. Actually we stayed in a minuscule "garden room", with the privet bathroom on the other side of the corridor. The hotel was clean enough. Linens and towels were clean. We had two beds, one good and one too soft. The room as extremely small, low ceiling and one window. Actually it was almost half of Anne Franks hidden room, we've seen at the museum. But the staff was extremely helpful and friendly in every way, they made what they could to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The breakfast was ok, bread, coffee, milk, orange juice, cereal, cheese and ham. And the location was extraordinary. A quiete neighborhood, very close to the center. Walking distances from every touristic attraction in Amsterdam. So, if you can stand a bit of frustration, I really think this hotel is worth it. Save a few bucks and spend them in some other good things you like.

Reviews.Title: “As long as your not expecting something posh and snazzy....it's not too bad”
Reviews.Author: FM09
Reviews.Content: Taxis are quite expensive from the airport so we took the train from Schipol airport to Station RAI and then caught the metro to Weesperplein...but then found it quite difficult to find the hotel (especially with all our baggage).....we later found that it was much easier to get a tram to RAI from one of the tram stops round the corner from the hotel and then the Train to Airport - which we did on our return journey. Upon arrival we were at first accused of not paying for out hotel room in advance (as they could not find any receipt of payment)......we had to use to receptionist's laptop to log onto our online bank account to prove to her that we had paid them 2 months prior to our visit......she later found their payment confirmation "filed in the wrong month". We then had to pay 15 euros "City Tax" (no returnable) and a 20 euro deposit on the room key (which we did receive when we checked out). Our room was on the 3rd floor (reception however is in the basement) so carrying our bag up the narrow steep stairs was a bit knackering after our long journey to get there...but not the end of the world. Check in is at 2pm so we did initially hav 2 dump our bags in the "breakfast room" and return later in the day to move them into our room. At first it appears that theres not much going on in the area but if u take a minute walk round the corner you'll find a nice little market, and a few cafes and bars...Theres a Lidl right outside the hotel too...so we stocked up on pop and cheap beer (0.49 euros per can....compared to 5 euros a pint!!) and some munchies too. Once you get your bearing its quite easy to access Dam Centre from where you are. We walked everywhere for the first 3 days (taking about half an hour - ish - to get into the heart of things...maybe about 10 mins to get to the Museum areas. Did get a bit tiring after a while..so we started to use the tram which is a little confusing at first when you dont know what you're doing. Just remember to swipe your pass on the way on AND OFF the tram or your pass becomes invalid. The nearest Tram stops are Staadhauskade and Frederiksplein (about 3 mins from hotel)...I think it was Tram number 4 to get into the centre. There was a dodgy "Coffee shop" called Ibiza on the corner of the street by the hotel - for "smokers" - which was a bit scary and seemed to be full of dodgy looking blokes all the time...so if you do intend to go to a coffee shop..i would suggest you go to one nearer the centre...theres a few nicer looking ones near "9 streets". Yes, the room was teeny weeny - we already knew this after reading other peoples reviews...so as long as you know what to expect, you wont be too disappointed....we actually thought it was bigger than expected. We paid for a twin/double room.....take not that the beds are two single beds....as a couple, we tried to push them together however, if we lay too close the middle of them, we seemed to fall throught the middle...so maybe not such a good idea. The mattresses werent too bad, although my partner found them uncomfortable....but not very sterdy. The duvets were clean but very old n faded so could maybe do with some new ones...a little dusty under the beds though. And yes, the toilet is kind of in the shower...we found this quite funny more than anything though....although there was very little privacy when using th bathroom as the bathroom doors was a glass (not see through) screen! Shower wasnt too bad, generally had nice hot water....except for the one day i wanted to wash my hair ...and as if by magic...the water was freezing! It wasnt as noisy as we expected...although you could hear other guests talking outside the room (as they obviously dont have any respect for the other guests trying to sleep at 6 in the morning) and you didn hear beds shuffling from above and your next door neighbour elbowing the wall......still managed to get an ok nights sleep though. Breakfast was a bit crappy.....cheap sliced bread, cheap sliced cheese (like burger cheese) and cheap sliced meat, a few cereals to choose from (but warm milk)...and orange juice n coffee (kind of cold)..but we hadnt expected much anyways after reading reviews....it filled a hole anyway. Staff werent too friendly but there were a few who gave us travel advice when we asked,,,and theres loads of leaflets on things to which was useful. Overall we had a pretty great week in Dam and although the hotel was pretty basic...it didnt matter because we were out all day and only had to go back to sleep in it. Was a little expensive for how basic it was.....but was the cheapest place we could find at all in april.....this i guess was mainly due to the poor exchange rate. Everything over there is super expensive right now.. Would recommend to young couples or small groups of friends (for short stays)...not really ideal for older couples (due to all of the stairs)...and maybe not so family friendly. Not really suitable for super romantic weekends (due to single beds and not so private bathroom) but good for a laugh and giggle. As long as your not expecting anything too psoh or snazzy...it's not too bad..

Reviews.Title: “No costumer care. You paid in advance in order to avoid any kind of complaint!”
Reviews.Author: richardmotton
Reviews.Content: Max hotel was terrible. The staff was rude, unfriendly and not helpful at all. We find out that: TV was broken, bed was broken, window was broken, no clean towels but, breakfast was ok. Breakfast room is located next to the reception, going down the stairs. We ask to speak with the manager about the general situation (was extremely poor) and the woman at the reception was extremely rude and a bit aggressive. I would certainly not recommend this hotel, and I can believe that a costumer find a used condom in the bed. This is the most terrible hotel in the world. Local authorities should revoke the license to run a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Max...a Rip Off!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl035
Reviews.Content: I was charged 110 euro a night for a room that was like a cupboard....charged in full before I got there and saw the room, and also slapped another 10 euro city tax! The room was extremely small in the basement near the reception, noisy with no conveniences. The staff were unhelpful in providing any alternatives in moving us to another room. If I paid 40 euro I would have taken it without complaint but not what I paid. They refused to give any part of a refund, so we left after 4 hours and incurred alot more expense as we simply could not stay there....not two young women. Seriously....if you are thinking about staying here, think again!

Reviews.Title: “unacceptable sanitary amenities”
Reviews.Author: zvonarka
Reviews.Content: low budget Hotels rooms in Tokyo are much bigger compare to the rooms in this hotel ! But what really shocked me was the size and state of the bathroom: 1- hardly 2m2, 2- no sink in the bathroom itself as no room. the small sink was actually outside the bathroom but in a corner in front of the cupboard, which made it impossible t stand in front of the sink itself. you had to be side way. 3-once you open the bathroom door, the toilet is right there on the threshold. So, it means that when seating on the toilet you cannot close the door. And for guys, you just stand in the bedroom because it is then not possible to close the door behind you: conclusion: we had to use the shared toilets on the floor as they were of a "normal" size; 4-right aside the toilet is the shower corner. My partner is quite chubby and was not able to use the shower. In addition, there was a unbearable smell of mold as soon as the water starting running. Disgusting! We paid EUR 65 / night / breakfast included, but the room is only worth EUR 20! to be avoided at all cost if you like decent shower and toilet facilities!

Reviews.Title: “Pubic Hair & Condom in Bed!”
Reviews.Author: putnikprice
Reviews.Content: First of, the hotel was very expensive and overrated for what was offered. We found our room to be in the basement across from the reception, storage room and the dinning room, (so it was very noisy). Upon our arrival, the hotel charged us extra money for some sort of "city taxes." First impression was terrible, the room was dirty. There were holes in the dirty walls. Also we couldn't open the window, because someone could just walk in. (since many people were passing by). One morning, a man unlocked the door of our room, without knocking or any warning. He CAME IN looking for something until I said "hello?" -shocked at the invasion of our privacy. He then just left the room without a word or explanation. Later, we realized this man was the receptionist at this hotel. In BOTH of our beds we found PUBIC HAIR and a USED CONDOM. When we asked for our sheets to be changed, the woman only changed the bottom sheet, looking at us in surprise and disbelief when we asked for the top sheet to be changed as well. In the end we ended up having to change the sheets on the bed ourselves. The overall experience was unimaginable, and so horrific it couldn't be compared to any other hotel experience we had. It compleatly ruined our experience in Amsterdam, and any sense of privacy and safety in a hotel. We felt robbed and exposed. I would NOT suggest this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad as a hostel but terrible as a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silva5
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is fine - situated within a relatively quiet district. It is a 10 minute walk to Rembrandt Square and 2 minutes to the nearest tram stop. The hotel itself however leaves a lot to be desired. The room that we stayed in was about 50cm wider than the width of a double bed. There was a tiny (and I mean tiny) cubicle that housed the toilet and the shower (the toilet is in the shower) - one is unable to shut the door of the cubicle and sit on the toilet at the same time, such is it's small size. It also had a slight odour of drains. The sheet on the bed was made of terrytowelling and had a hole in it. But by far the worst thing about the room was the complete lack of any sound insulation. We could hear everything in the next room and any movement on the floor above was like a herd of elephants moving furniture around. Not great when people are returning in the early hours of the morning and it was certainly not conducive to a good night's rest. Breakfast is included but the dining room didn't have enough seating to accomodate all of the residents at the same time. We came down to breakfast and couldn't find a seat initially so we left and returned twice to check for space. When there was finally a free table available we were quite rudely informed that breakfast was over despite our protestations that we had in fact been on time but unable to physically get into the dining room. Some of the staff were helpful but one particular member was quite the reverse. To sum up, if the Hotel Max described itself as a hostel rather than a hotel and you are planning on not doing much sleeping then it's acceptable. If you however want a relaxing break with any level of comfort then do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else. This "hotel" spoiled our stay in Amsterdam which was otherwise very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: smudgeygirl
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 nights, 5 females in our party,all in one room with private facilities.Yes,the hotel is very basic,but it is clean and staff are friendly.You don't go to Amsterdam to sit in your room though!!The city has soo much to offer,our time there went so quickly as there is so much to do and many tastes catered for.The hotel is in a quiet spot,which was good for us we felt very safe walking back at 4am in the morning!! The Rembrantsplein is about a 7 minute walk,on the way you pass many a bar and some fab restaurants(everywhere else seems to be food on the go)If you are wanting your time to be spent at The Red Light District this is a good 20 min walk and I would advise a hotel closer.The hotel I would say is not a hotel more of a hostel with clean facilities,you get towels, a tv in the room a safety deposit draw all within the price and a daily change of towels and beds made.There is also no curfew so you can party till the wee hours!!!! We had lots of FUN

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and unpleasant -- without even linens to compensate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We should have read these reviews before visiting. Beds featured only a terrycloth cover on the mattress and an (unwashed) duvet. Dark halls, tiny rooms, and a seriously unfriendly staff. Would have been disappointing at any price.

Reviews.Title: “hotel max”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The prices are GOOD rated. The owners are still improving the hotel and are very nice. You can see that they are changing the hotel step by step. Breakfast is separatedfrom the room. For 8 euro you can eat so much HOTEL MAX THANKS FOR GREAT STAY JOHN

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Chrispyphillips
Reviews.Content: When my girlfriend and I were booking a hostel on-line before departing for Amsterdam, Max in Mokum was a last minute choice becasue of its relatively cheap prices. I wish i'd splashed out a little more! When we arrived, it was possibly one of the farthest hotels from the centre, so much time walking, or money spent on tram rides was needed to get around. The room we booked was advertised as a double room, with TV and central heating. We had none of this. A room in the back garden (the only place people would smoke), with 4 single beds, 1 small radiator, and TV that had no ariel greeted us on arrival. Throw in a simple clothes storage (one tower with a coat hook and three small shelves) convinced us that the room could not get any worse! Read on... Whilst staying at the hotel for 5 nights, me and my significant other were bitten on every single part of our body by small parasites unkown to us, and even had to endure the buzzing of mosquitos/midges directly in our ears when trying to sleep. Lack of sleep and much discomfort affected the days, which we made the most of regardless. Take nothing away from the City, Amstersdam is one of the best places I have ever been to, with sights such as the Red Light District, Vondelpark and the sex museum to name but a few, there really is no limit to the beauty and appeal of this fantastic attraction. The food and drink is to die for, although not too cheap. The "cafes" appeal to many of the visitors, and they are plenty. Please when visiting this city, make the most of your trip by NOT staying at Max in Mokum. Okay, maybe we had a bad experience, but dont take the risk, it does ruin it a little bit!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOR ALL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff who helped us very well. All sites are close by. Good restaurants. Nice unbelieveble outdoor albert cuyp market one block away. Formely known as hotel hemonyhof. Owner of the hotel arranged tickets for soccer and theater. We paid more for an sold out match but it was great. Cosy small clean bye bye and see you again nice people of hotel max

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An overpriced, small, dank, dark and dingy out of the way place with appalling business practices. Move on folks -- there's many, many places to stay in Amsterdam, no need to waste your time and money with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: JuliaP_79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hemonyhof for 2 nights back in January and it was lovely! Although located slightly off the beaten track, it can be easily reached by tram in about 5 mins from Cetraal station. They upgraded us immediately when we arrived as there were better rooms available and did not charge us any extra! The local area is cool as well, and has some smaller coffee shops where you will find cheaper prices and more locals than tourists. There is also a local market which reminded me a bit of Walthamstow market in East London (for those of you who have been there.) Staff were friendly and breakfast was great with a good level of variety. Really pleased and would recommend this place to couples and singles of any age.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been in November 2003, my room was very small and not confortable, the breakfast and the position is ok also the price it's ok

Reviews.Title: “Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hemonyhof Hotel for 6 nights. I'm a big fan of staying outside the tourist districts when I travel. The hotel is only a 20 minute walk from the city center. The Hemonyhof is situated one block from the Albert Cuypmarkt which is one of the best outdoor markets I've ever experienced. And there are 2 of my favorite coffeeshops nearby, Carmona and YOYO. The breakfast was excellent, the owners were willing to do almost anything to make your stay more enjoyable. TV in my room w/private facilities, phone...all of which are rare at a 1 or 2 star hotel in amsterdam. I will definetly stay there again!

HotelInfo.Name: Max in Mokum
HotelInfo.Address: Hemonystraat 7 and Stadhouderskeid, Amsterdam 1074 BK, The Netherlands
